question: Which countries share the location of "Lusatian Mountains"?
explanation: The Czech Republic and Germany share the location of Lusatian Mountain Range. It is a part of the Western Sudetes Mountain Range. In Germany, it is called Zittau Mountain. It lies adjacent to the Ore Mountain Range and Elbe River Valey. Lausche Peak is the highest peak of this mountain range which is 793 metres above sea level. It is composed of sandstone and granite rocks.
